column3: JPja
column4: USen

column3: ここは？
column4: What is this place?

column3: なにしてるの？
column4: What are you doing?

column3: さようなら
column4: Bye.

column3: 武器にする！
column4: As a weapon!

column3: 火をつける！
column4: To set things on fire!

column3: ヒミツ
column4: It's a secret...

column3: こりゃ わしの焼きリンゴじゃぞ！
column4:
I BEG YOUR PARDON! I do believe that
is my baked apple! You can't just go
about taking whatever you please!

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ

冗談じゃよ…
リンゴは こんがり焼いたぐらいが美味いんじゃ
column4:
Oho ho! Forgive me—I could not resist
pulling your leg.

Please help yourself. An apple and an
open flame make for a succulent treat.

column3: むう…
column4: Hmm...

column3: 祠のお宝楽しみにしておるぞ
column4:
I look forward to seeing what type of
treasure you secure out there.

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
パラセールが欲しかったら がんばることじゃ
column4:
Oho ho! If you still wish to acquire the
paraglider, you must put in the effort.
I will not simply give it away, you see.

column3:
むう…
用もないのに起こすでないぞ
column4:
Hmph! To an old man, a sound sleep is
more valuable than gold. Please do not
disturb me unless you have need of me.

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
あったかくて気持ちがいいわい
column4:
Ah, invigorating! I encourage you to
join me by this warm fire.

column3:
わしは しばらく ここにおるでな…
何かあれば また訪ねるがいい
column4:
I shall be here for some time.
Please let me know if I may
be of service.

column3:
のう… お主
どこか行くところが あるんじゃないかの？
column4:
Do you not have somewhere else to be,
young one?

column3: 裸とな…
column4: Aren't you...a bit chilly?

column3: ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
column4: Oho ho!

column3: Zzz... Zzz...
column4: Zzz...

column3:
ちょっと体が冷えてのう
たき火にあたって休んでおるのじゃ
column4:
Oh... I was just feeling a chill. A warm
fire can do wonders for a weary soul.

column3:
ひまをつぶすには たき火が一番じゃ
炎を見ていると時が経つのも忘れるからのう
お主も どうじゃ？
好きなだけ ゆっくりしていくがいい
column4:
A campfire is a wonderful place to
pass the time.Staring into these flames, it's easy to
lose track of the hours...

Bah! Please ignore my ramblings.
Feel free to relax here for as long
as you'd like.

column3:
ひまをつぶすには たき火が一番じゃ
好きなだけ ゆっくりしていくがいい
column4:
A roaring fire makes it easy to pass
the time. Feel free to relax here for
as long as you'd like.

column3:
たき火に ゆっくりあたって
また焼きリンゴでも こしらえるとするかのう
食材は そのまま食うのもいいが
あぶった方が栄養も増して美味いんじゃ
column4:
I'm relaxing by the fireside, of course.
Although I'll need to cook myself another
baked apple at some point...
Simple foods such as apples are fine to
eat raw, but roasting them on a fire
makes them tastier and more nutritious.

column3: うん？ なんじゃ？
column4: Hm? What's this?

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
また会うたな
column4: Well, hello. So we meet again...

column3:
そんな格好じゃ寒かろう
たき火にでも あたっていかんか？
column4:
You'll catch a chill out there in the wild.
Come warm your bones by the fire.

column3:
夜は魔物も増えて危ないぞ
朝まで ひまをつぶしていかんか？
column4:
Vicious beasts answer the night's call in
greater numbers. Feel free to pass the
time here with me until the light of morn.

column3:
なんじゃ…
せっかく寝てたというにのう
column4:
Hrm?! What's that? It seems there is
no rest for the old and weary.

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
そこのたき火に あたっていかんか？
column4:
Oho ho, what are you waiting for?
Come and sit by the fire.

column3: 祠のお宝は まだかの？
column4:
I take it you are still searching for
some of the treasure hidden here
on the plateau, correct?

column3:
祠探しのほうは どうじゃ？
はかどっておるかの？
column4:
So then... How goes your endeavor to
explore the shrines?

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
わしに何か用かの？
column4: Yes? How might I be of service to you?

column3:
ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
やっぱり話がしとうなったようじゃの？
column4:
Oho ho! So you fancy yourself the
strong silent type, eh?

column3: うん？ なんじゃ？
column4: Yes?

column3: ふぉっ ふぉっ ふぉっ
column4: Oho ho!

column3: 何をする！
column4: What is this?!

column3: 何じゃ？
column4: What is it?!

column3: ひぃーっ！
column4: Whoa!

column3: ぬわーっ！
column4: Huh?!

column3: あちゃっ
column4: Toasty...

column3: ひぃーっ！
column4: Whoa!

column3: ひぃーっ！
column4: Whoa!

column3: やめんか！
column4: Easy there!

column3: その たいまつ どうするつもりじゃ？
column4:
Well then, just help yourself to that
torch there. And how, may I ask,
are you planning to use it?

column3:
ぶっそうなヤツめ…
そいつは火をつけるのに使うもんじゃ
この先には魔物もおる
武器なら もっとマシなのにするんじゃな
column4:
Innovative... However, that is probably
best used to light fires. If you need a
weapon, you can find something better.

column3:
わしのオノでもいいのなら その辺にあるぞ
持っていくがいいわい
column4:
Many beasts roam the land past this
point. You can take my axe with you,
if you please. Assuming you can find it.

column3:
わしのオノを持っているようじゃが
そっちの方が役に立つんじゃないかのう
column4:
Ah, I see you found my axe. I do believe
it will be of more use to you than it is
to me.

column3:
あぶないヤツめ…
燃えやすい草の近くで振り回すんじゃないぞ
とはいえ この先には魔物もおるでな
いざとなったら武器として使うのもいいがな
column4:
That is rather...unnerving. Please be
cautious with that around any dry
grass that might catch fire.
You know, there are plenty of monsters
in this area. That torch would make
a good weapon, if need be.

column3:
ふん…好きにするがいいわい

言っておくが この先には魔物がおるぞ
いざとなったら武器としてでも使うんじゃな
column4:
I see. Well then, do as you please.


There are plenty of monsters ahead of
here, though. Remember that you can
use that as a weapon, if need be.

column3:
適当に振り回さずに相手を向いて
しっかりと間合いをとることじゃ
column4:
However, do not just swing it around
without purpose. You must face your
opponents and lock your sights on them!
